jobs_data.title: Cloud Engineer I (VMware) + (Veeam/Zerto)
jobs_data.description:
The Role:

11:11 is looking for a Cloud Engineer L1 to support and guarantee a positive post-implementation experience for all 11:11 customers. This position is responsible for the optimization, implementation, and maintenance of our organization’s cloud-based systems. The Cloud Engineer L1 will drive customer success through effective problem resolution and strong customer relationship management. This position will require an individual with a penchant for detail and a continuous improvement mindset. This is a full-time position reporting to the Manager of Service Operations.

What You’ll Do:

-Represent Cloud Support by being the initial point of contact for our customers while ensuring they feel supported and valued.
-Deliver support services (via chat, phone and email) to meet 11:11 Systems’ Service Level commitments to customers.
-Manage the ticketing system intake queue to provide rapid response to new tickets entering the system
-Participation in an on-call after hours rotation.
-Provide accurate, professional responses to customer queries and concerns and escalate as necessary within support (L2/L3), to ensure customer satisfaction.
-Practice extreme ownership of incident ticket(s) within area of responsibility
-Follow 11:11 Systems best practices for service management.
-Deliver superior customer service while maintaining professional relationships.
-Work supportively with colleagues, operating in a manner that is consistent with 11:11’s Code of Business Ethics and Company Values
-Responsibly receive, transmit, and handle company data and information per Company data handling agreements, work procedures and policies
-Review and follow company policies and guidelines, data privacy practices, including annual compliance training certification and policy acknowledgements
-Additional duties as assigned


Who You Are & What You’ll Bring:

-High school diploma and 2+ years recent experience as a technical, hands-on, external customer facing support engineer with active listening skills.
-Solid understanding of and experience with virtualization technologies, such as VMware, OpenStack, AWS, etc.
-Extensive knowledge and experience using VMware, Zerto and Veeam administrator, and management tools (vCenter, vCloud Director, VMware Configuration Manager).
-Excellent investigative skills and written and verbal communication skills to effectively and efficiently document client issues.
-High energy, positive attitude with a desire for technical and professional growth.
-Detail and goal-oriented with demonstrated technical knowledge and consultative skills
-Ability to pursue positive outcomes for assigned tasks independently while managing multiple issues simultaneously
-Strong time management and decision-making skills in conjunction with adaptability and accountability for both.
-Understanding of cloud-based infrastructure services, such as BaaS, IaaS and DRaaS.
-Must be legally eligible to work in assigned without visa sponsorship


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Benefits:

- Standard Life Pension Scheme
- Healthcare Insurance Plan
- Cash Plans
- Income protection
- Life assurance
- Paid Vacation & Holidays
- Leave of absences

jobs_data.title: Software Engineer, Intern
jobs_data.description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
We’re seeking exceptional engineers with a passion for backend, data, infrastructure, mobile, or security & privacy. While we'll consider your preferences, our engineers are encouraged to move across different areas of the company, and everyone holds the title of software engineer.
No matter your seniority, you will work on production code, directly improving our products or adding new exceptional features. At the moment, most teams use Python, Typescript, or Java for the backend, and Kotlin and Swift for mobile. Our approach to software development is highly flexible, and we adapt our tech stack to the needs of the different products.
Please note that our internships (both full- and part-time) require a minimum commitment of 6 months.
A few examples of your responsibilities: -Work closely with other software engineers to expand our set of libraries and make our processes ever-more efficient.
-Learn about the latest and greatest technologies, testing the promising ones to make sure we don’t miss out on game-changing opportunities to boost our productivity and potential for impact.
-Constantly improve the quality of our products, tools, or infrastructures by fixing bugs and refactoring the code base where necessary.

What we look for -Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
-Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
-Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
-Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
-You can work at least 20 hours per week. A full-time commitment is preferred, but we’ll consider applicants who can commit to at least 20 hours per week.

What we offer -Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
-An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
-Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €63,965. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between €105,737 and €143,330. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
-All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contractInternship. Part-time or Full-time.
LocationMilan (Italy) or fully remote.
Before you applyBending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.
The selection processIf you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

jobs_data.title: AI Scientist - Paris/London
jobs_data.description:
Role summary

We are a small, creative team with high scientific standards. We make compute-efficient, useful and powerful AI models with both a strong research focus and a fast-paced entrepreneurial mindset. We are hiring experts in the role of pre-training and fine-tuning large language models.

Key Responsibilities

-Develop novel methods and research ideas to improve the performance of our models
-Evaluate and improve the performance of our models on a variety of use cases (e.g reasoning, code, rag, tool use, agents) and across modalities (text, image, speech)
-Develop tooling to facilitate data work and modeling iteration
-Work cross functionally with other scientists, engineering and product teams to ship novel AI applications



You may be a good fit if

-You are familiar with Python
-You are a highly proficient software engineer in a least one programming language (Python or other e.g. Rust, Go, Java)
-You have, hands-on experience with AI frameworks and tools (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Jax)
-You have high technical engineering competence. This means being able to design complex software and make them usable in production
-You have a high scientific track record in a field of science
-You are a team-player, self-starter and autonomous
-Collaborative and have a real team player mindset



Now, it would be ideal if

-You have hands-on experience with Generative AI (e.g. experience with transformer based models), a broad knowledge of the field of AI
-You’re an expert in your AI field
-You have a publication record
-You have a strong interest in fine-tuning and using language models for applications
-You are able to navigate the full MLOps technical stack, with a focus on architecture development and model evaluation and usage
-You have experience in Audio/Speech experience - audio input/out, NLP etc



Note that this is not an exhaustive or necessary list of requirements, please consider applying if you believe you have the skills to contribute to Mistral's mission, we value profile and experience diversity.

Benefits

-Competitive cash salary
-Equity



France

-🥕 Food : Daily lunch vouchers
-🥎 Sport : Monthly contribution to a Gympass subscription
-🚴 Transportation : Monthly contribution to a mobility pass
-🧑‍⚕️ Health : Full health insurance for you and your family
-🍼 Parental : Generous parental leave policy
-🌎 Visa sponsorship



UK

-🧑‍⚕️ Health : Competitive Healthcare program
-🏠 Pension : Monthly contribution
-🚴 Transportation: Monthly contribution
- 🥎 Sport: Monthly contribution
-🌎 Visa sponsorship



About Mistral

At Mistral AI, our mission is to make AI ubiquitous and open. We are passionate about bridging the gap between technology and businesses of all sizes. We are a leading innovator in the field of open-source large language models.

Our advanced LLM solutions can be seamlessly deployed on any cloud, allowing for optimized integration and robust performance. Developers are using our API via la Plateforme to build incredible AI-first applications powered by our models that can understand and generate natural language text and code. We are multilingual at our core. We released le Chat, as a demonstrator of our models.

We are a tight-knit, nimble team dedicated to bringing our cutting-edge AI technology to the world. Our teams are distributed between France, UK and USA. We are creative, low-ego, team-spirited, and have been passionate about AI for years. We hire people who thrive in competitive environments, because they find them more fun to work in. We hire passionate women and men from all over the world.

jobs_data.title: Software Engineer, Intern
jobs_data.description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.
To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.
For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.
We’re seeking exceptional engineers with a passion for backend, data, infrastructure, mobile, or security & privacy. While we'll consider your preferences, our engineers are encouraged to move across different areas of the company, and everyone holds the title of software engineer.
No matter your seniority, you will work on production code, directly improving our products or adding new exceptional features. At the moment, most teams use Python, Typescript, or Java for the backend, and Kotlin and Swift for mobile. Our approach to software development is highly flexible, and we adapt our tech stack to the needs of the different products.
Please note that our internships (both full- and part-time) require a minimum commitment of 6 months.
A few examples of your responsibilities: -Work closely with other software engineers to expand our set of libraries and make our processes ever-more efficient.
-Learn about the latest and greatest technologies, testing the promising ones to make sure we don’t miss out on game-changing opportunities to boost our productivity and potential for impact.
-Constantly improve the quality of our products, tools, or infrastructures by fixing bugs and refactoring the code base where necessary.

What we look for -Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
-Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
-Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
-Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
-You can work at least 20 hours per week. A full-time commitment is preferred, but we’ll consider applicants who can commit to at least 20 hours per week.

What we offer -Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
-An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
-Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €63,965. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between €105,737 and €143,330. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
-All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contractInternship. Part-time or Full-time.
LocationMilan (Italy) or fully remote.
Before you applyBending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.
The selection processIf you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.
Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

companies_data.name: 11:11 Systems
companies_data.description: 11:11 Systems (“11:11”) is a managed infrastructure solutions provider that holistically addresses the challenges of next-generation managed cloud, connectivity and security requirements. 11:11 combines the teams and technology behind market leading, analyst vetted companies like Sungard AS and iland to deliver increased performance, optimization and savings. 11:11 provides cloud, connectivity and security solutions from its global footprint of data centers throughout North America, Europe, Australia and Asia.

jobs_data.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs_data.description:
¡Bienvenido/a a Binaia! 😊
En Binaia somos profesionales especializados en personas relacionadas con el mundo IT, donde trabajamos un depurado modelo de Headhunting & Recruiting, centrándonos en conocer tus intereses y expectativas, y en base a ello, ofrecerte un proyecto que se ajuste al máximo a tu ideal profesional 👬
Nuestro modelo tiene su origen en Bosonit, donde contamos con diferentes empresas tecnológicas, con proyectos muy variados: Data Engineering, Data Science, IA Gen, Software Development, DevSecOps, IoT, CRM, ERP, Robotic, Mobile, etc. 💻
En esta ocasión, buscamos un compañero para formar parte de la familia Bosonit 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦. Contamos con proyectos de consultoría en grandes clientes, así como con diferentes Startups tecnológicas donde desarrollamos producto propio 🧪
🎯¿Qué estamos buscando?Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un compañero/a Data Engineer con más de 4 años de experiencia.
📌 Requisitos: -Contar con 4 o más años de experiencia como Data Engineer.
-Amplio dominio en los lenguajes de programación Python/Scala y SQL.
-Acostumbrado a trabajar con cantidades masivas de datos con Spark.
-Dominio de cloud con AWS y Azure, trabajando con el entorno de Databricks.
-Experiencia trabajando con la plataforma de Cloudera.
-¡Y, por supuesto, habilidades para trabajar en equipo!

💡 Ofrecemos: -Formación continua en tecnologías, idiomas y certificaciones tecnológicas📚
-Jornada laboral flexible 😍
-After Works y eventos deportivos 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦
-Eventos tecnológicos y Techs Experiences 👩‍💻
-Incorporarse a una Compañía consolidada y con posibilidades reales de crecimiento profesional 📈

¡Esta es tu oportunidad!Si deseas obtener más información puedes consultar los siguientes enlaces:https://bosonit.com/

jobs_data.title: Azure Cloud Engineer
jobs_data.description:
En Rastreator, el bróker online de seguros y el comparador líder en España, nos centramos en asesorar y aconsejar a nuestros clientes para que elijan las mejores ofertas en seguros, hipotecas, telefonía, energía y otros productos, con precios garantizados y ofertas exclusivas.
Nuestra misión es ayudar a las personas para que tomen las mejores decisiones brindándoles una excelente experiencia de usuario. Y todo esto es gracias al trabajo entre equipos, la gran colaboración entre departamentos y la calidad humana de nuestros empleados.
Combinamos el trabajo de un entorno ágil y dinámico buscando la constante innovación como en una startup, con el know-how y la tecnología de una empresa consolidada. Y compartimos la pasión que te hace poner todo el esfuerzo en cada cosa que haces, día tras día, para seguir construyendo una empresa que sea un referente.
Somos un equipo inclusivo, en el que valoramos la igualdad de oportunidades y apostamos por el crecimiento personal y profesional.
Actualmente nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un/a Ingeniero/a Cloud - Azure para unirse a nuestro equipo de IT.
Tus funciones principales serán las siguientes: -Gestionar infraestructura en Azure (IaaS, PaaS), máquinas virtuales, balanceadores de carga, gateways.
-Gestionar y administrar los servidores en Azure, snapshot, rendimiento, firewall.
-Gestión de red a nivel de Azure (vnet, express route, VPN)
-Colaborar en migración a Cloud (Azure), gestionando los recursos (servicios, máquinas virtuales, redes, seguridad).
-Poner foco en la optimización de costes de la infraestructura.
-Ayudar el equipo de Data en la creación de bases de datos en la infraestructura de Azure.
-Proponer e implementar planes de recuperación en caso de desastre DRP.
-Serás una pieza clave en la mejora continua e iterativa del departamento.

Qué necesitamos de ti:Al menos 3-4 años de experiencia en: -Gestión y administración de servidores Windows.
-Scripting (Power Shell).
-Monitorización (deseable Azure monitor y/o Grafana y/o Kibana y/o LOKI).
-Sistemas de Seguridad, ModSecurity, WAF Firewall.
-Conocimientos de redes, app-gateways, DNS, Certificados, KeyVault a nivel de Azure.
-Valorable conocimientos de Docker, Kubernetes, K3s.

Qué te ofrecemos: -Salario Fijo + Variable.
-Modelo de trabajo híbrido (2 días/semana en oficina de Madrid)
-Horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.
-25 días de vacaciones. Adicionalmente tendrás la opción de comprar 5 días extra.
-El día de tu cumpleaños tendrás un permiso de 3 horas.
-Paquete de retribución flexible (restaurante, transporte y guardería).
-Seguro médico para ti y tu familia, seguro de vida y Plan de Bienestar (Membresía Plataforma Urban Sport Club, App de contenido saludable, Iniciativas que fomentan la actividad física y la nutrición saludable, Plataformas de descuentos y mucho más...).
-Acceso a plataformas de E-Learning.
-5 días extra de vacaciones pagados para participación en voluntariado/proyectos solidarios.
-Actividades disruptivas periódicas, Day off y fiesta en Navidad.
-Oficina pet friendly.
-Un equipo humano diverso con el que disfrutarás aprendiendo y trabajando.
-Excelente ambiente de trabajo - Empresa Great Place to Work.

jobs_data.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs_data.description:
BC Digital Services, es una empresa especializada en desarrollo de proyectos software.Forma parte de Grupo BC, desempeñando la labor de transformar tecnológicamente aquellos procesos derivados del core del negocio y creando productos de software desde cero en clientes de otros sectores.Nos define nuestro servicio de alta calidad en el desarrollo de arquitecturas, prescripción de nuevas herramientas y aplicación de metodologías ágiles.
Actualmente, necesitamos incorporar en nuestros equipos un/a Full Stack Developer.
Conocimientos necesarios:• Experiencia en desarrollo y mantenimiento de API REST utilizando .NET (versión 6 en adelante) y .NET Core• C#, TypeScript, JavaScript• Conocimientos sólidos de CSS, HTML• Desarrollo y mantenimiento con Angular.• Herramientas de control de versiones: GIT, SVN• Base de Datos: SQL
Conocimientos deseables:• ASP (Active Server Pages) con Vbscript.• TFS
Requisitos:• Experiencia: 3 a 4 años en puestos similares y trabajando con .NET y Angular.• Familiarizado/a con Metodologías Ágiles.• Formación en informática, desarrollo de aplicaciones software o una experiencia laboral equivalente.• Trabajo en equipo y colaboración: Disposición para trabajar en equipos multidisciplinarios y colaborar estrechamente con otros desarrolladores.• Resolución de problemas: Enfoque analítico para identificar y resolver problemas de implementación o configuración.• Por condiciones del proyecto es necesario residir en MADRID.
Que tendrás en BC Digital:• Estabilidad laboral: incorporación bajo contrato indefinido.• Apostamos al crecimiento de nuestros colaboradores a través de un Plan de Formación contínua y certificaciones técnicas.• Programa Club de beneficios para empleados de BC Digital.• Nuestro horario de trabajo nos permite conciliar la vida familiar y profesional: jornadas de 8:00 a 16:00 horas y viernes con jornada intensiva.• Horario de verano: jornada intensiva en julio y agosto.• Modalidad híbrida: 4 días de teletrabajo y 1 día en oficina.• Salario acorde a la experiencia, posición y mercado.• Un equipo con ideas frescas, innovadoras y muchas ganas de crecer profesionalmente.
BC Digital Services es una compañía que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Todos/as los/las candidatos/as cualificados/as serán considerados para el empleo sin distinción de raza/etnia, color, religión, sexo, orientación sexual, identidad de género, nacionalidad, discapacidad, edad o cualquier otra condición protegida por la ley.

jobs_data.title: Software Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Who we are and what we doAt LuxQuanta, we are pioneering the Quantum Communications industry by delivering solutions that use the properties of quantum physics to secure communications. As we spearhead our international expansion after our first three years of solid growth, we invite passionate individuals to join us on our journey. We expect you to help us continue leading the fast-paced market of Quantum Communications in Europe and beyond.
We are seeking an experienced software engineer to join our team to work on Quantum Key Distribution
When you join LuxQuanta you will: -Develop high performance system programming QKD modules for system control, postprocessing, error correction and data analysis.
-Develop inter-module communications through APIs and RPCs.
-Define and implement databases for cryptographic key management and system metric visualization.
-Collaborate with the team in the maintenance of build, testing and deployment pipelines, ensuring continuous delivery of the products.
-Create comprehensive documentation that meets high standards for clarity, detail, and accuracy.

Qualifications/Experience: -Software Engineer (+4 years of experience)
-Knowledge of Linux environment at user level
-Proficiency in Rust or C/C++, with strong experience in systems programming
-Solid understanding of embedded systems and low-level programming concepts
-Demonstrated ability to write clean, efficient, and maintainable code
-Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies
-Strong problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail
-Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, with a proven track record of working effectively in team environments
-Proficiency in LaTeX. Scientific documentation writing is a plus
-Experience in data visualization is a plus

What we offer: -Competitive salary.
-Opportunities for professional development and career growth in a vibrant multicultural work environment in Barcelona.
-Flexible working hours and hybrid/ remote work model.
-Reduced working hours and short Fridays during the Summer.
-Office in a prime location near Castelldefels Beach.
-Convenient commute options from Barcelona, including a shuttle bus and easy access by train or car.
-Private health insurance fully financed by the company.

IMPORTANT: candidates should expect feedback from the Company in mid-January.
You can apply through this job publication or by sending an email to RRHH@luxquanta.com with an updated version of your CV.

jobs_data.title: Applications Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Who we are and what we doAt LuxQuanta, we are pioneering the Quantum Communications industry by delivering solutions that use the properties of quantum physics to secure communications. As we spearhead our international expansion after our first three years of solid growth, we invite passionate individuals to join us on our journey. We expect you to help us continue leading the fast-paced market of Quantum Communications in Europe and beyond.
As an Applications Engineer you will serve as the technical bridge between the technical team and its clients, ensuring the successful implementation, integration, and optimization of technical solutions. Your role involves understanding customer needs, configuring and deploying applications, resolving technical challenges, and providing ongoing support to maximize system performance. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, deliver training and documentation, and contribute to the continuous improvement of products and services. This position offers a dynamic environment where technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and customer-focused communication are key to success.
When you join LuxQuanta you will: -Collaborate with customers to understand their technical requirements and translate them into solutions.
-Configure and deploy software applications to meet customer needs.
-Provide technical support during the pre-sales, implementation, and post-sales phases.
-Analyze and troubleshoot system and application issues, ensuring timely resolution, both remotely and at customer’s premises.
-Develop and deliver technical presentations, proof of concepts (PoC), product demonstrations, and training sessions.
-Work closely with internal teams, including R&D and product management, to ensure customer satisfaction, provide ongoing feedback to customers, and improve product and quality assurance procedures.
-Document technical specifications, processes, and customer interactions for knowledge sharing.
-Stay updated with the latest advancements in industry, technologies and trends.

Qualifications/Experience: -Bachelor’s degree in Telecommunications Engineering or Computer Science, or a related fiel
-2+ years of experience in a similar role, preferably in an international environment.
-Proficiency in programming or scripting languages such as Python, SQL, or Bash, along with familiarity with databases and APIs.
-Knowledge in networking and network security (e.g., IPSec, Firewalls, MACSec) is highly desirable.
-Proven experience in troubleshooting and resolving application or system-level issues.
-Strong communication skills, both written and spoken in Spanish and English (knowledge of any additional EU language is a plus).

What we offer:
-Competitive salary.
-Opportunities for professional development and career growth in a vibrant multicultural work environment.
-Flexible working hours and hybrid work model.
-Reduced working hours and short Fridays during the Summer.
-Office in a prime location near Castelldefels Beach.
-Convenient commute options from Barcelona, including a shuttle bus and easy access by train or car.
-Private health insurance fully financed by the company.

Important: applicants should expect feedback from LuxQuanta in mid-January.
Simply apply through this job publication or by sending an email to RRHH@luxquanta.com with an updated version of your CV.

jobs_data.title: Deep Learning Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Company DescriptionNitid AI specializes in leveraging Explainable AI to solve complex technological problems and optimize industrial processes with a focus on sustainability. Our AI-driven solutions aim to enhance operational efficiency and contribute to a greener future by making decisions transparent, actionable, and impactful.
Collaborations and EcosystemNitid AI thrives at the intersection of global innovation and local expertise. With strong ties to the AI and entrepreneurial ecosystem at MIT in Boston, we remain at the forefront of the latest advancements in artificial intelligence.In addition to our international collaborations, we are deeply embedded in the Basque Country's technological landscape. Our headquarters are located in the iconic Bizkaia Accelerator Tower (BAT) in Bilbao, complemented by our state-of-the-art AI Lab at the University of Deusto. These strategic locations provide us with unparalleled access to the vibrant network of Basque tech companies, fostering innovation and collaboration to drive impactful AI solutions.
Role DescriptionThis is a full-time on-site role for a Deep Learning Engineer at Nitid AI, located in the heart of the vibrant city of Bilbao, along the stunning Bay of Biscay on the northern coast of Spain.
The Deep Learning Engineer will be responsible for developing and implementing cutting-edge deep learning algorithms, designing and training neural networks, optimizing models for performance, building efficient preprocessing pipelines, crafting robust coding and algorithm design strategies, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into various complex projects.
Qualifications -Deep learning, neural network design, and model optimization skills
-Proficiency in machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras
-Strong programming skills in Python
-Advanced knowledge of mathematics, statistics, and algorithms
-Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
-Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities
-Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

jobs_data.title: Desarrollador/a Sr. C++ Microcontroladores
jobs_data.description:
¿Te apasiona el desarrollo de soluciones IoT y el software embebido? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo donde la innovación tecnológica es el motor?
Nos encantaría incorporar a un Desarrollador/a Sr. C++ y microcontroladores. Se trata de algo especial, ya que se trata de un partner para el que llevamos trabajando mucho tiempo; y donde hemos cultivado una relación de confianza y seguridad, donde se ve claramente reflejada en un nuestros/as técnicos/as e ingenieros/as de desarrollo de SW, FW y HW.
¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Un entorno donde la innovación y la tecnología están a la vanguardia. Un puesto híbrido y flexible, pensado para que alcances un equilibrio óptimo entre tu vida profesional y personal.
¿Qué beneficios podrás obtener de este nuevo proyecto?
Entrarás a formar parte de una empresa que te proporcionará conocer y hacer uso de tecnología SW y HW más puntera.
Podrás ver y conocer el ciclo completo de la funcionalidad de su producto y servicio, puesto que son los que diseñan y fabrican su producto, sin olvidarnos de que una parte muy importante de su plantilla la forman personas de I+D+I.
Serás parte de la seguridad que todos queremos en nuestras casas, trabajos e infraestructuras públicas que todos usamos, puesto que son referente internacional en crear soluciones en cuanto a seguridad crítica de accesos. Además, de la aplicabilidad y diversidad que tiene respecto a sistemas IoT, entre otras cosas.
¿Qué te espera en este rol? Te sumergirás en proyectos avanzados de IoT, donde podrás:
-Crear y optimizar software embebido en C++ para microcontroladores de 32 bits, enfocándote en el rendimiento y la confiabilidad.
-Dominar la comunicación con periféricos (UART, SPI, I2C) y trabajar con protocolos de aplicaciones IoT como HTTP.
-Gestionar configuraciones de control de versiones (GIT, SVN) para asegurar que el desarrollo esté siempre organizado y listo para crecer.

REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:
¿Qué te hará triunfar en nuestro proyecto?
REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS: Son aquellos que dominarás a la perfección.
-Experiencia sólida en C++ y en programación de microcontroladores de 32 bits (preferiblemente del fabricante ST).
-Conocimiento en aplicaciones IoT y protocolos de comunicación como HTTP.
-Habilidad para comunicarte con periféricos y manejar sistemas de control de versiones (GIT, SVN u otros).
REQUISITOS DESEABLES:
-Experiencia en módulos de comunicaciones inalámbricas y geolocalización.
-Familiaridad con FreeRTOS, Azure IoT C SDK y securización de comunicaciones.
-Nivel de inglés técnico para formar aprte de proyectos que se integren en otros países.
-Conocimientos adicionales en Linux embebido, diseño de interfaces gráficas y protocolos como MQTT.
¡Si estás listo para llevar tu carrera al siguiente nivel y desarrollar soluciones de alto impacto, queremos conocerte!

jobs_data.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Join Our Innovative Team as a DevOps Engineer and be a part of a dynamic team that is transforming the future of retail intelligence!
Shalion is a data-driven company working for world-class manufacturers and brands worldwide. With its Digital Shelf Optimization and Retail Media solutions, Shalion provides innovative tools that facilitate e-commerce monitoring.
We, at Shalion, enable brands to make smarter business decisions in eCommerce, based on actionable data and insights providing information on online product prices, availability, share of search, etc. in more than 800 e-retailers and 50 different countries. Our client portfolio includes industry giants such as Heineken, Lego, Danone, and Nestlé.
The role
We are currently looking for a DevOps Engineer. Our ideal candidate is highly passionate about technology and an open-minded person who is looking to advance in their professional career.
As a DevOps Engineer at Shalion, your responsibilities include:
-Supporting Platforms team to manage and maintain our cloud-based infrastructure on AWS.
-Improving infrastructure value by process automation.
-Helping Platforms team to manage, maintain, define, improve and grow our on-premise infrastructure.
-Supporting to monitor and manage our edge proxy networks.
-Supporting other team members to define the best workflows according to best practices.

Your profile should include the following:
-3+ years of experience working as part of a data team as a DevOps/ SRE working with AWS.
-Relevant experience in managing Linux systems and distributed systems.
-Some experience managing Python applications, not full-time programming experience.
-Wide knowledge of Networking.
-Knowledge of High Availability services.
-Docker and containers clustering Ecosystems (Kubernetes, Docker, ECS...).
-Knowledge of CI/CD workflows, issues and pipelines (Github Actions, ArgoCD) .
-Knowledge about concepts of Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
-Being open-minded, humble, assertive and emphatic.

Ideally, you will also have:
-Experience with Data tools, such as Airbyte or Airflow
-Experience with Snowflake
-Experience with Datadog

What we offer you
-Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
-To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment;
-Hybrid work: one to two remote days and three to four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance;
-A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
-International environment with more than 10 nationalities
-Fresh fruit and coffee every day
-Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarrià- Sant Gervasi).
-Permanent contract.
-Flexible remuneration.
-Competitive salary.

jobs_data.title: .NET Developer
jobs_data.description:
We’re the world’s leading sports technology company, at the intersection between sports, media, and betting. More than 1,700 sports federations, media outlets, betting operators, and consumer platforms across 120 countries rely on our know-how and technology to boost their business.



Job Description

Are you ready to take your career to the next level by helping us build a product that millions of users use daily?

We support more than 100K transactions per second combined, and we are working for much more because we aim to be one of the top three e-gaming and betting software development companies recognised worldwide for adding the most value to its partners.

For this reason, we are looking for software engineers who are enthusiastic about building modern, resilient and scalable applications.

We need our engineers to be versatile, capable of mentoring and enthusiastic about taking on new challenges as we continue to push technology forward.

We are product-oriented engineers with a growth mindset.

Our products need to handle data at a vast scale and extend well beyond betting and gaming.

We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, data processing & storage, security, UX/UI design, and mobile; the list goes on and grows every day.

We are curious problem solvers; we collaborate, communicate, share knowledge and technical ideas, and thrive together.

We give you autonomy over the software you build and offer you the freedom to choose the right tools for the job.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

You’ll spend time on:

-Working collaboratively with product owners and other engineers to create the best product for your customers within our next application.


-Ensuring operational excellence of your services / applications.


-Understanding how our business works and how products add value to your customers.


-Learning and sharing experiences on new technologies and trends and how you can leverage them in current and future products.


-Collaborating and sharing knowledge with others across the group.


-Exhibiting passion and showing commitment to drive change.




We are looking for these skills:

-4y+ experience in .NET (C#, ASP.NET)


-3y+ experience with SQL


-Good level of English is mandatory




Another valuable knowledge:



-Knowledge of DB programming languages (PL/SQL, Transact-SQL, ...)


-Experience in Java.


-Clean code, refactoring and TDD.


-Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.




ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Maybe you will appreciate this information:

-Part of Sportradar MPS Engineering (team of ~200)


-Which is part of Sportradar.com (team of more than 2000)


We also offer:

-Continuous learning program with technical internals sessions for continuous improvement.


-Access to our online e-learning platform.


-Internal training sessions during office hours to learn and grow, such as “Coding Dojo” sessions which we have to learn and share coding techniques.




Additional Information

At Sportradar, we celebrate our diverse group of hardworking employees. Sportradar is committed to ensuring equal access to its programs, facilities, and employment opportunities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We encourage you to apply even if you only meet most of the requirements (but not 100% of the listed criteria) – we believe skills evolve over time. If you’re willing to learn and grow with us, we invite you to join our team!

jobs_data.title: Senior Back End Developer (.NET)
jobs_data.description:
Join ForceManager (SAGE Group) as a Senior Back End Developer (.NET)
At ForceManager we’re looking for a passionate Senior Back End Developer (.NET) to strengthen our team. If you're an experienced developer ready to lead technological evolution in .NET environments, we want to hear from you!
What will you do? -Be a key member of our BackEnd development team.
-Cooperate in the evolution of our .Net C# and Backend technology.
-Cooperate to migrate from .Net Framework to .Net Core.
-Design and implement our API-based services.
-Develop and optimize our Windows applications and services with a strong focus on data synchronization and transmission.

What we’re looking for: -Minimum of 5 years’ experience in software development.
-C#
-.Net Framework and .Net Core
-Web API
-Entity Framework
-Microsoft SQL Server
-Containers and microservices
-Unit testing (xUnit)
-Fluency in Spanish and English

Nice to have: -Azure (development and deployment).
-Amazon Web Services (AWS).
-Golang.
-Javascript / Typescript.
-Migrating applications from .Net Framework to .Net Core.
-Advanced database management.

What do we offer: -Hybrid working
-Flexible working time and Friday afternoons off - Start your weekend early! 🕒
-23 days of Holidays per year and flexible national days off 🌟
-Gym membership 🏋️
-ForceManager covers 100% Private Health Insurance 👩‍⚕️
-Employee and customer referral programs 🌟
-A supportive and dynamic team with virtual and in-person gatherings, and the best Summer and Christmas parties 👥
-An excellent opportunity to expand your knowledge and thrive in the Software as a Service (SaaS) ecosystem📲

About Us
ForceManager, part of the SAGE Group, is the pioneering mobile-first CRM redefining the future of sales through cutting-edge AI technology. As a key player within SAGE, a global leader in accounting, finance, HR, and payroll technology for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), we are committed to digitizing and accelerating sales processes, empowering sales teams to achieve their goals faster and more efficiently. Together, we’re driving innovation and the digital transformation of businesses worldwide.
Our intuitive platform, boasting integrated geolocation and high user adoption rates, now includes Dana AI - an intelligent assistant designed to streamline communications, shorten response times, and boost overall sales performance.
Our Barcelona-based company, with a diverse and international team, serves over 1,600 companies worldwide. As we continue to innovate, our focus remains on enhancing the user experience and revolutionizing sales processes, upholding our vision to be the leading CRM for B2B mid-market sales teams on-the-go.
---
Tritium Software, S.L. (ForceManager) is the data controller for the processing of personal data received from candidates who apply for this offer. The data received will be processed exclusively for the purpose of considering and managing the application. Once the selection process has been completed, in the event that the candidate is not selected, their data will be kept blocked for the legally stipulated periods of conservation and prescription of responsibilities. The legal basis for such data processing is the implementation of pre-contractual measures at the candidate's request. Some of these processors may be located outside the European Economic Area, in which case ForceManager will have adopted the appropriate data protection safeguards in advance. Data subjects may exercise their rights of access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, data portability and object, as well as withdraw their consent at any time without affecting the lawfulness of the processing prior to its withdrawal, by sending their request to ForceManager (A/A DPD), C/Josep Irla i Bosch, 1-3 2ª planta 08034 Barcelona; or to the email address dpo@forcemanager.net. jobs_data.title: Quality Assurance Engineer
jobs_data.description:
What is DerbySoft?Founded in 2002, DerbySoft is a technology company whose mission is to make the travel business easier through industry leading technology that empowers travel industry services. The company supports technology for Connectivity Services at the CRS and PMS levels, Marketing Services which uses machine learning and rich data to drive high-performing marketing campaigns and a Content platform that collects, manages and distributes quality hotel content. DerbySoft’s technology empowers the travel industry around the globe. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, USA and with offices in Barcelona, Tokyo and Shanghai, DerbySoft serves partners in 197 countries around the world.
DerbySoft has this opportunity and more with our online travel and hospitality industry software that we support around the world! This position is in a new team that will deliver cutting-edge Java solutions and will be responsible for the technical components for development, optimization, and user testing for our connectivity platform.
What will you do?DerbySoft is looking for a passionate QA Engineer eager to jump into a fast-paced R&D team and tackle compelling projects. We are a highly technical organization focused on software development, creativity, and on building meaningful features/functionality. This position is in a team that delivers cutting-edge Java solutions and is responsible for expanding the product’s features and functionality. The focus of this role includes maintaining the test repositories, mentoring other team members, managing the team workflow, and maintaining sprint metrics. -Prepare test plans and design test cases
-Set up the whole test environment independently, including new added components
-Use database and write SQL statements for add, delete, query and update statements
-Execute other types of tests (security, performance, interface, etc.)
-Assign testing tasks and guide T1-2 to complete testing work

What do we need? -B.S. in Computer Science or related discipline, or commensurate industry experience.
-QA certifications from ASQ or ISTQB a plus
-Minimum 5 years of experience in software QA with a strong understanding and demonstrated use of best QA practices and methodologies
-Ability to fully understand requirements and give feedback from a QA perspective. Can design test cases for multi-system interactions. Can review use cases and give suggestions for improvement.
-Be able to analyze the main system problems and their root causes based on test results and help the development team to improve.
-Be able to design performance test plans, complete performance tests and collect basic performance test metrics based on test requirements. Be able to analyze basic performance test metrics and complete performance test reports.
-Ability to complete automation script development according to testing requirements to ensure effective improvement of test execution efficiency and save human capital.

What do you have to bring to the table? -Excellent verbal and written English required
-Have a full understanding of the product or project system which you are responsible for Familiar with basic computer theory knowledge.
-Master software testing theory and methods and be able to apply them to the work
-Master REST protocol and mocking tools & techniques.
-Master Linux operating system and related operations
-Master the use of test management tools
-Master three or more test case design methods
-Familiar with at least one common automated testing framework, such as robotframwork or in-house developed framework, etc.
-Familiar with common performance testing tools, such as JMeter, Tsung, LoadRunner, etc.
-Execute performance tests according to test requirements and complete test reports
-Master at least one security testing tool, and can execute according to security test cases

Why work with Derbysoft? -We offer competitive salary based on experience, annual bonuses and referral bonuses
-Peer recognition programs
-Health benefits
-Pension plan
-Transport and restaurant tickets
-Free coffee! (To recharge your batteries)
-Working from home
-Casual work environment where teamwork is key
-Nice and comfy office at the city center (Diagonal)!
-Work with passionate experts who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow!


Please send CV’s in ENGLISH!Please Note: *No agency or contractor resumes accepted*No Visa Sponsorships for this position*No relocation assistance

jobs_data.title: Senior Backend Engineer - Grafana IRM (Remote, Spain)
jobs_data.description:
Senior Backend Engineer - Grafana IRM (Remote, EMEA)

This is a remote opportunity and we would be interested in applications from EMEA time zones.

What We Do

We’re responsible for our IRM solutions that aim to make it easy to detect, respond, and learn from incidents with minimal effort. This includes our OnCall Cloud offering, our Incident Cloud offering, and our IRM mobile application.

We’re a cross-functional team that works closely with Product, Design, and Documentation to define our goals and build our solutions. We embrace experimentation, lean principles, and encourage everyone to share their ideas and perspectives.

What You’ll Work On

-Coding new features, enhancing the operational experience of the systems you develop, and iteratively improving them based on production insights.
-Contributing to and reviewing design documents.
-Taking an active role in shaping the team’s roadmap.
-Collaborating with different teams across the organization.
-Owning the experience of our customers by participating in weekday 12h x 5d and a separate weekend 24h x 2d on-call rotations.



This role and team are a good fit for you if:

-You are comfortable working in a remote-first company and understand the importance of communication.
-You enjoy working as a team. For us, working together means being collaborative, friendly, kind, and respectful. We support each other, defaulting to mentoring and teaching.
-You have solid experience as a Software Engineer building full stack applications. Ideally, you feel comfortable working with either Golang or Python and React.
-You know how to transform ideas into working code – you are able to design a solution, get feedback, and write a prototype by yourself.
-You enjoy learning, growing, and supporting others to do the same.
-You care deeply about user experience and the quality of the products that you work on.
-You enjoy working on complex solutions – Grafana is a highly technical solution and has avid followers who rely on it every day and care deeply about their workflows.
-You care and value code maintainability, readability and testing.



You have experience with developing software that runs in the Cloud or some experience with systems engineering

-You understand the implications of technical decisions, how they’ll affect the codebase and the team.
-You enjoy being part of the community. Community is part of our core, and interacting with the community is a day-to-day thing for us, whether that community is internal or external.
-You are able to communicate clearly in written and spoken English.



What we use

The purpose of this section is to give a sampling of the technologies that are currently in use by this squad (and the projects with which we interact). Experience with the entirety of these technologies should not be seen as a requirement. It is more important to recognize the purpose of these tools, and possess the experience / ability to learn how to apply (or interact with) them effectively where appropriate.

-Backend technologies: Strong expertise in Golang or Python and familiarity with other backend languages is valued. Experience with Django is a plus.
-Containerization and orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes.
-CI/CD and DevOps: Knowledge of building pipelines, automated testing, and deployment strategies.
-Monitoring and observability: Familiarity with tools like Grafana, Prometheus, or other observability platforms.
-Frontend technologies (nice to have): TypeScript, React, Mobx, and Webpack.



In Spain, the Base compensation range for this role is €80,571- €100,713. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable) and other benefits listed here.

-Compensation ranges are country-specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.



About Grafana Labs: There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies -- including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay -- manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).

Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.

For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.

jobs_data.title: IT System Engineer
jobs_data.description:
About us:
Hexagon is the global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software and autonomous technologies. Our solutions free our customers to harness the rapidly-increasing amounts of data, putting it to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector and mobility applications.At our very core is a powerful vision of a future where data is fully leveraged so that business, industry and humanity sustainably thrive. We believe in a world where economic growth does not come at the expense of the planet and its people, and that we should drive sustainability efforts in every aspect of our business.Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 24,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 5.2bn EUR. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB.
Role Description:
You will be an IT System Engineer working within the Microsoft Identities & Messaging (M365) team. In this role, you are responsible for designing, implementing, operating and supporting our cloud and on-premises infrastructure (mainly focussing on Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) and Active Directory Domain Services), identifying potential optimizations and improving our current processes.

Responsibilities:
Apply and grow existing functional knowledge and technical expertise in the Microsoft cloud offerings and develop to become a technical subject matter expert on both on-premises and cloud systems with focus on Microsoft 365
-Will support an existing team responsible for Active Directory Domain Services architecture and infrastructure (including troubleshooting of issues, enhancements / upgrades, security hardening, establishing connectivity to peripheral business systems etc.)
-Ensure that identities in Entra ID are provisioned, protected and monitored ideally and assist with integrations to other SaaS applications
-Work as part of the global third level support team providing timely, customer focused response via the Global Service Desk
-Define governance and security measures for M365, keep track of new solutions, technologies and vulnerabilities, and participate / lead projects and improvements in the identified

Profile:
-Bachelor's Degree in computer science, computer engineering, management information systems, information technology or a similar field. An equivalent combination of education, certifications and experience may substitute for a degree
-Microsoft and security certifications are an advantage
-Previous experience of AD architecture and infrastructure (Kerberos, LDAP, Directory Replication, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, PKI, Azure AD Connect, etc.)
-Previous experience of Entra ID and Azure Premium features and functionalities, including (but not limited to) Defender for Identity, Conditional Access, MFA, App registrations, SCIM provisioning, SSO (SAML, OIDC, OAuth2…) etc.
-PowerShell Scripting
-English (fluent written and verbal) is a pre-requisite

Benefits:
-Competitive remuneration package: fixed part + bonus paid 2 times a year in March and September. The bonus is calculated according to the company's performance.
-Stable employment conditions: permanent contract
-Ticket Restaurants (2420 euro net by year)
-Life insurance paid by the company
-Possibility to apply at any time for private medical insurance with Adeslas
-Modern office in an attractive location in Barcelona (5 minutes walking from Sants Train Station)
-Friendly and international working environment with collaborative spirit. We have employees with +33 different nationalities in our Barcelona office!
-Access to an online platform reserved for our employees where you can benefit from discounts on more than 50 brands including fashion, technology, travel, culture, etc.
-Remote work policy: the company provides 250 euro per year gross to manage internet and other expenses.
-Teleworking model: hybrid model with a lot of flexibility
-Flexible benefits in transport, education, kindergarten.

jobs_data.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Sobre tu misión
Si GuruWalk ha llegado donde está hoy y sigue teniendo esta ambición de crecer, es gracias al desarrollo tecnológico de la plataforma, a nuestra capacidad para adaptarnos y de ofrecer una gran experiencia a los viajeros (walkers) y potentes herramientas de trabajo a los guías (gurus), experimentando e innovando constantemente.
Es por eso que buscamos ingenieros con talento que quieran el desafío de tener cercanía e impacto directo sobre el producto, con espíritu de equipo y ganas de aportar lo mejor de sí mismos. El rol del software engineer es fundamental para garantizar que tengamos un software robusto, ágil, innovador y atractivo para poder seguir creciendo, aportando valor a nuestros usuarios y expandiendo nuestro concepto de turismo hasta el último rincón del planeta.
Estarás trabajando en todas las áreas del proyecto, tanto en la web privada de los gurus, para dotarles de herramientas de gestión innovadoras, que les permitan gestionar sus tours, calendarios, reservas, etc. como en la parte pública de los walkers y en el backoffice y herramientas de administración para el resto de los equipos.
No sólo estarás programando, sino que participarás activamente en la definición y planificación de todas las soluciones, e incluso en la estrategia global de la compañía, trabajando codo con codo con todos los equipos y stakeholders.
Ofrecemos -A tiempo completo
-Contrato indefinido
-Sueldo de 35-60k pero negociable según tu experiencia y conocimientos
-Subida automática de sueldo (cada 6 meses)
-Horario Flexible (Organizas tus horas de trabajo como quieres)
-Vacaciones flexibles (Min. 22 días, no hay límites o control
-Oficina luminosa y fácil de acceso en Valencia (Estaciones de Metro Pl. Espanya y Xátiva)
-Tu escoges el ordenador que quieras, nosotros te lo damos.
-Comida y fruta gratis todos los días, formación pagada y en horario laboral.

¿Cómo trabajamos? -Trabajamos en iteraciones cortas y con entrega continua
-Utilizamos metodologías ágiles, que adaptamos según las necesidades del equipo.
-La colaboración y la mejora continua del equipo es clave y por eso realizamos retrospectivas de manera periódica.
-El desarrollador es máximo partícipe en la toma de decisiones sobre el producto. Nos caracterizamos por la cercanía entre el desarrollador y el producto. Trabajamos directamente con todos los equipos y stakeholders.
-Infraestructura cloud virtualizada basada en AWS, Kubernetes y CI/CD.
-El equipo técnico toma todas las decisiones sobre la tecnología en la que se trabaja, y hay mucho sitio para probar cosas nuevas y experimentar.
-Nos preocupamos por crear código de calidad, tests automatizados, refactorización, revisiones de código y pairing cuando es necesario.
-Nos esforzamos por automatizar y hacer que los procesos sean más eficientes y escalables (los nuestros, los del resto del equipo y de nuestros usuarios)

Requisitos: -Min. 4 años de experiencia en desarrollo de software
-Experiencia en trabajar en un entorno ágil.
Mentalidad orientada a tomar decisiones sobre el producto. Tendrás que decidir qué construir y de qué manera.
Lo que más valora el equipo de trabajar en GuruWalk: -La autonomía y la confianza que damos a cada uno (libertad y responsabilidad).
-La gran flexibilidad de horario de trabajo y vacaciones.
-Pertenecer a un equipo unido y motivado de personas con mucho talento.
-Inversión en formación continua, también durante la jornada laboral (una tarde cada dos semanas).
-Eventos de teambuilding y ocio frecuentes.
-Comida a cargo de la empresa todos los días.

¿Qué esperamos de ti?Lo que compartimos todos en GuruWalk: -Eres una persona autónoma: puedes gestionar todo tipo de tareas relacionadas con tu misión: autogestión y priorización de tu trabajo.
-Eres una persona conseguidora: eres proactivo, crítico, te encantan los retos, cuestionarte y estar en constante movimiento.
-Eres buen compañero: te importa relacionarse, colaborar con tus compañeros y ser buena persona.

Sobre GuruWalk
GuruWalk es el marketplace líder mundial en visitas guiadas de libre pago (free tours) que ya utilizan más de 200k viajeros cada mes, con un crecimiento interanual x4. Además, somos una empresa rentable que no depende de nuevos inversores.Nuestra misión es crear una compañía con una cultura ejemplar para ser super ágiles ante problemas complejos y situaciones inciertas (como es una startup) y enfocando toda nuestra energía en maximizar el valor que aportamos para el negocio y la sociedad.Aplicamos esta misión al free tour como modelo innovador y disruptivo del turismo y donde nos posicionamos como expertos. Así nos acercaremos cada vez más de nuestra visión de un mundo donde todos los viajeros, sin importar su presupuesto, harán un free tour como primer contacto en una ciudad, abriéndose más la mente sobre el lugar que visitan.
Algunos hechos relevantes: -Fundado en Valencia en 2017
-Más de 1 millón de euros de inversión externa
-Más de 3,5 millones de viajeros han hecho free tours con nosotros
-No se despidió a ningún miembro del equipo durante el COVID y alcanzamos break even en 2021 a pesar de las restricciones
En 2023 hemos logrado tener presencia en más de 120 países y 800 destinos.
▶️ Aquí tienes el formulario para aplicar: https://guruwalk.typeform.com/to/rsnurJMQ

jobs_data.title: Software Engineering Intern, Front End
jobs_data.description:
Cambridge Mobile Telematics (CMT) is the world's largest telematics service provider. Its mission is to make the world's roads and drivers safer. The company's AI-driven platform, DriveWell® Fusion, gathers sensor data from millions of IoT devices — including smartphones, proprietary Tags, connected vehicles, dashcams, and third-party devices — and fuses them with contextual data to create a unified view of vehicle and driver behavior. Auto insurers, automakers, commercial mobility companies, and the public sector use insights from CMT's platform to power risk assessment, safety, claims, and driver improvement programs. Headquartered in Cambridge, MA, with offices in Budapest, Chennai, Seattle, Tokyo, and Zagreb, CMT measures and protects tens of millions of drivers across the world every day.

CMT is looking for a collaborative, customer-committed, and creative Front-end Inter who wants to join us in making roads safer by making drivers better!

Responsibilities:

-Collaborate with our portal team to design, develop, and maintain web portals
-Work on frontend projects using React and/or Angular to create user-friendly interfaces
-Assist in developing and maintaining backend systems with Python
-Integrate REST APIs to connect frontend and backend components
-Support database management tasks with PostgreSQL
-Contribute to cloud deployment and development tasks on AWS
-Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and code reviews
-Complete any additional tasks as they arise


Qualifications:

-Is currently pursuing a Bacherlor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or has equivalent experience).
-Has basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
-Has some exposure to programming languages like Python, TypeScript/JavaScript.
-Is familiar with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and understands basic SQL.
-Has an interest in web development, REST APIs, and cloud technologies like AWS.
-Is curious, eager to learn, and willing to take on challenges.
-Possesses good communication and collaboration skills.


Compensation and Benefits:

-Fair and competitive hourly rate based on education level
-Flexible scheduling options depending on role and responsibilities


Additional Perks:

-Feel great working to improve road safety around the world!
-Join one of our many employee resource groups including Black, AAPI, LGBTQIA+, Women, Book Club and Health & Wellness
-CMT will do all that is possible to support our employees and create a positive and inclusive work environment for all!


Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:

At CMT, we believe the best ideas come from a mix of backgrounds and perspectives.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to creating a workplace and culture where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to bring their unique talents and perspectives. Diversity is essential to our success, and we actively seek candidates from all backgrounds to join our growing team.

We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability state. "CMT is headquartered in Cambridge, MA. "To learn more, visit www.cmtelematics.com and follow us on X @cmtelematics."

jobs_data.title: C++ Developer
jobs_data.description:
Job Description

Job requirements

We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. Our team of developers consists of those with 15+ years of commercial experience in various fields, to fresh graduates in Computer Science, Physics and Mathematics. A university degree or work experience with C++, together with a fresh and creative problem-solving approach would be an excellent combination for this role.

As all of our recruitment steps are task-based, the selection is based on the skills demonstrated during our tests.

- Language: fluent English or German. We only require one of those languages
- Tech stack: C++ (overall language knowledge, we don`t require latest standards e.g., C++ 17), algorithms
- Working experience: any, we have several fresh university graduates
- Remote: o remote position is open exclusively to candidates residing and working within the time zones of UTC-1 to UTC+4

jobs_data.title: Remote Coding Expertise for AI Training (French)
jobs_data.description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Outlier, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Outlier helps the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

About the opportunity:

-Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
-This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by...

-Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
-Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples of desirable expertise:

-Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
-Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
-Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in French
-Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment:

-Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
-Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants' needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.

jobs_data.title: Software Developer
jobs_data.description:
We are looking for proficient programmers to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.As part of the application process, you will be asked to complete an assessment. If you pass, you will gain access to projects. Based on the quality of your work, you will continue to receive projects regularly. We find our most successful candidates work between 5-20 hours per week, up to 40 hours.Benefits: -This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
-You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
-You can work on your own schedule
-Projects are paid hourly, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work
Responsibilities: -Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
-Write high-quality answers and code snippets
-Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance
Qualifications: -Fluency in English
-Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
-Detail-oriented
-Excellent writing and grammar skills
-A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you.

jobs_data.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs_data.description:
Job Title: Full Stack Developer

Location: Hybrid HQ in Los Angeles area (Burbank)

How to apply for this jon?

- Click apply, input your info, attach your resume, and submit your application
- Take this AI Assessment that is unique to this job. Candidates that score well will have their application expedited!


About The Company

We are an innovative technology company on a mission to revolutionize healthcare access for rural communities. Our goal is to create a cutting-edge product that bridges the gap between patients and providers, delivering care that feels personal, live, and immediate. By leveraging advanced technologies, we strive to offer efficient, effective, and impactful solutions that ensure everyone, regardless of location, can experience high-quality healthcare. Join us as we build a future where distance is no longer a barrier to care.

Job Summary

We are seeking a talented and versatile Full Stack Developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of our web applications. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, product managers, and other developers, to deliver scalable and user-friendly solutions. As a Full Stack Developer, you will work on creating seamless user interfaces, implementing robust server-side logic, and managing databases. You will also play a key role in troubleshooting issues, optimizing application performance, and staying updated with emerging technologies to enhance our development processes.

Key Responsibilities

-Design and implement robust APIs and microservices to support scalable, secure, and efficient application architectures, ensuring smooth communication between various system components.
-Integrate healthcare data sources, such as Electronic Health Records (EHRs) and other health data platforms, to enable unified access, comprehensive analysis, and streamlined workflows across systems.
-Ensure seamless connectivity and interoperability of clinical devices, facilitating real-time data exchange, improved monitoring, and effective integration within healthcare environments.


Requirements

-Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
-Experience:
-Experience in Full Stack development
-Knowledge of healthcare is a plus
-Skills:
-Familiarity with Python, Node.js, and other relevant frameworks

Benefits

-Competitive Salary: $150,000-175,000
-Health and Wellness: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans, flexible spending accounts, and wellness programs.
-Work-Life Balance: Flexible work arrangements, paid time off, and paid parental leave
